Reviews.Title: “Geat Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Marshall S Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel which we booked online. This hotel was better than we even expected. The location was fantastic right on Rembrandt Square with many restaurants and cafe's and walking distance to many sites. The room was very nice and with a great view overlooking the square. The only drawback for some but not for us was that the square could be noisy at night even with the windows closed. For us the view and liveliness made up for the noise. I strongly recommend this hotel if you are looking for great value and a very nice hotel while in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Jolene G
Reviews.Content: The main reason to choose this hotel is for it's location. Rembrandt Square has so much to offer. The tram stop is 30 seconds outside the hotel door, which will take you to the Dam, Central Station and Anne Frank's House. The hotel itself is clean and comfortable. However, staff are not as friendly as they could be. They were polite and courteous but made no effort to go that extra mile. The breakfast is ridiculously expensive so we chose not to pay for breakfast. Instead there are lots of nice cafes around the square serving breakfast for much more reasonable prices. We liked Frame, where the staff was always very jolly. The wifi connection is also over priced and the hotel computer is painfully slow. However, for it's comfort and it's ideal location, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a bit noisy at the front”
Reviews.Author: BigBlue1894
Reviews.Content: Rembrantsplein is a great location and only 20 minutes walk to almost anywhere. The number 9 tram goes from Central Station and the 14 takes you over to the Jordaan. There's lots of bars and restaurants in the square although the food leaves a little to be desired. The hotel is a little dated but comfortable. If you're at the front you'll definitely need the complimentary earplugs that they leave by your bed. There's no AC so during the summer the noise from the square will probably be an issue unless you're getting to bed at six in the morning. The breakfast isn't bad but very Dutch with thin streaky bacon and quite the worse reconstituted scrambled eggs I've tasted for a long time. I went to the Irish bar across the road one morning but theirs was no better and gave me food poisoning. There's free WIFI in the reception that also stretched to some of the breakfast tables but it only lasts for 30 mins and then you have to log in again. No extra costs though.

Reviews.Title: “location is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at a leading spot of Rembrandt Square. Serrounded with caffeeshops bars. Whenever we step out of the hotel there was something going on in the middle of the square, either one guitar player, or some painters etc.. Beautiful place. I would strongly recommend anyone to stay in this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Great location but thats it”
Reviews.Author: flaljee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is smack in the middle of Rembrandt square. You are a few steps away from great restaurants and some great attractions. The hotel looks good from the outside and walking in, you get a feeling of the old dutch grandeur. The rooms are quite roomy as well, with great views of the square. However, you pay for internet and a lot. It is 18 euros for one day of internet, and that is just ridiculous. Mobile internet (iPad included) is 8 euros. In this day and age, I don't get how high end hotels continue to charge for internet. Moreover, my bathroom smelled really bad. I was there for two nights, but I didn't want to bother changing rooms. I did regret it on the second night, but what is amazing is that the cleaning staff didn't smell it and address it. There is no air-conditioning in the hotel, so it might not be comfortable in summer. I was there in March and it was hot in my room, enough to keep me up at night. The bed is not very comfortable and it was two single beds put together. While I didn't order room service (you don't need to with the Burger Bar, and Wok to Walk a few meters away), the menu didn't have anything to tingle my taste buds. So I advise passing on this hotel. In my opinion, it was not worth it. There are cheaper, better alternatives around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staying at the NH Schiller”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Clean rooms, good breakfast, excelent location!!! In a few minutes you are everywere in the city. Personel is very friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Hassel free hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: michelle w
Reviews.Content: The NH Schiller is located in Rembrandtplein in Amsterdam. The square itself is a little loud and seems to cater to the club scene on the weekend, however it is the perfect location! Central to everything, surrounded by plenty of coffee shops, cafes and the tram line. You can literally walk to all the major attractions within 15 minutes. The hotel staff was very professional, friendly and fast. The rooms are decent sized, exceptionally clean and very comfy! I would absolutely stay here again! We did not eat at the restaurant in the hotel, but did try a few on the square and had great experiences. Walk down the canal about five minutes to the nieuwmarkt square if you are looking for a quieter, picteuresque dining spot. You won't be disappointed. Villa Nieuwmarket is a great place for after dinner drinks. Cozy and very warm feeling with fantastic staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Freddie v
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. Go to the left when you leave Centraal Station and take Tram 9 which will stop right at the hotel on Rembrandt Plein. The rooms were roomy, if a bit dated. The lifts needed a good clean :-( The food was EXCEPTIONAL - highly recommended to try their restaurant/room service. Smokey coffee shop next door is brilliant for a beer and a game of pool - friendly, accommodating and very convenient. The noise levels because of the square is relatively high, but not unmanageable. The hotel leaves ear plugs for you on the bedside table - says something. We faced the square and the noise and lights did not bother us. Recommended hotel - we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Deco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, excelent location. Went as a group of 3 couples for a weekend break and had a lovely time. Will use this hotel again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Would go back.”
Reviews.Author: felvis
Reviews.Content: This pleasant hotel is located on Rambrandt Square, very close to the flower market. It is a 20 minute walk from the train station. It is with in the canal loop and most attractions are within walking distance (upto 30 minutes). The hotel itself is a lovely building, over 6 stories, although there are 2 small lifts.We stayed on the top floor so although the square is busy at night we were not affected by noise. There is a restaurant in the building but we did not eat here so I cannot comment. It was a lovely bright room though. The decor in the rooms is a little dated but we had a good sized room, especially considering hotel rooms are often tiny in Amsterdam. The room was clean and furnature in good condition. The bathroom was bright and clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel and I would try to stay here again if I returned to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST PLACE TO STAY in AMSTERDAM”
Reviews.Author: travel_channeLT
Reviews.Content: I was with family and the experience was just terrible. How can you stay in a hotel where it has windows looking to nowhere, the staff was terrible and not helpfull at all. I WOULD RATHER STAY ANOTHER TIME IN HOSTEL than THIS HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Deckard22
Reviews.Content: Well, for around Â£70 per night I think this is a great hotel. Location The location is good, right next to the flower market. Getting round Amsterdam involves a lot of walking (you will be tired) and the hotel is right in the middle of everything you would want to see. We were able to pop back for a siesta after a long slog before we headed out again for food and a beer. Our trip was a mid week one, so I don't think we saw the full glory of the Rembrandtplein, but it has a club a couple of coffee houses (we liked the 80/90s alternative music in the one closest to the hotel), a scattering of restaurants and a pretty nice square with a statue of Rembrandt proudly standing in the middle. I would imagine at the weekend it would get lively. The accommodation It's a medium sized hotel, doesn't feel corporate and has a few nice touches. The reception people were very helpful, very friendly and welcoming - which was a great. Reading the reviews on here we were careful anyway and asked straight away for a quiet room and we got one on the second floor. The room was clean and well worth the price. comfortable beds (twins) and a big bathroom (which was a little chilly). Everything worked, everything was of a decent standard and it served as a great chill out spot. There was a TV (and if you are interested - BBC1 and 2 were there). In the morning the breakfast was very good - a buffet with cold meats, eggs and sausages - along with the juices, cereals, bread etc. The breakfast area is in a lovely old bar - great atmosphere. Getting to the hotel If you are fit it takes about 20 mins to walk to the hotel from the train station - and you'd want to walk if you can, because you get to see the chinese quarter, the red light district, a very beautiful canal, and several lovely bridges. Trams run straight from the station here (which we didn't use) so if you are less mobile you can use them to get to the hotel. Accessibility There are a couple of small steps at the front of the hotel, but once in, any disabled traveller would have no problems getting round - the ground floor is all one one level and the lifts are spacious enough to get a chair in. What we liked about the trip Highlights for our trip was the food (some very lovely places) as well as being the typical tourist and visiting Vondel park, the Van Gough museum, the red light district and the canal walks. Only one moan - why oh why in 2012 is wifi not included in the room, for free. You can use 30 mins in the reception for free, but really it should be standard in the room. No biggie though - we weren't in Amsterdam to sit on facebook, or trip adviser.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Deeoh-11
Reviews.Content: Great location, huge room. Not a quiet hotel. Great value. Overall a great stay. Late checkout till 4 was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jena377
Reviews.Content: A good, clean hotel. We were there when there was a lot of snow and i can say that freezing as though it may have been outside we were very comfortable and warm in our room. The staff were friendly and we took the advice of previous travelers and when asked whether we would like a room at the front or back of the hotel we opted for the back, The only negative thing I would say was that the bathroom was very clinical and i expected a little more and the toiletries provided were not that great so i would take my own shower gel next time i stayed! Overall a very good, clean, friendly hotel in a great location and I would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brybert
Reviews.Content: The Schiller is a really wonderful hotel and lives up to it's 4 star rating.It's central location is ideal and it's right opposite the no9 tram stop so if you arrive by train is simple to get to.We arrived quite early morning and booked in with no problems through a very efficient staff member who,after a very easy check in, gave us plenty of hotel and local information.We had only booked a standard room and it was impressive with good decoration,ample furniture and a very good bathroom.The most notable thing was very comfortable beds which gave four nights of good sleep.Breakfast more than sufficient with both a good selection of cold and hots foods on a self serve basis and a good selection of teas,coffee's and fruit juice's.The food was good and especially the bacon which was cooked to a crisp not the usual fatty limp looking stuff.The bar is well stocked with a good selection of drinks but moreover the bar staff were two of the most friendly and informative people i have had the pleasure to be in company of.Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff they were always very polite and friendly.Check out too was very simple they even double checked our taxi requirements and ensured us the airport was operating normally as it had been snowing heavily the day before and the airport had closed for a time.Overall this hotel is first class and i would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel will be yours too”
Reviews.Author: frequenttravails
Reviews.Content: Atmosphere (paintings by the late owner) books in the room, the elevator and stained glass--- a nice restaurant in doors and next door a coffee house.... Yes this will fit all your needs and put a smile on your face. Class but personality the building is almost a personality. You will be happy you came here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice staff but hotel itself was just okay.”
Reviews.Author: Amy T
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights on and around New Year's Eve. We checked out the reviews first so asked for the quietest room possible and they were very accommodating. We weren't bothered by the noise at all in our top-floor room. Staff was great, especially when helping us find our way around town and tips on how to use public transportation. I do have to say though that we were a little surprised at how old the hotel was and maybe I'd even go as far as saying it was a little dingy? It was bearable but nothing really special. Breakfast was not worth the money so I'd suggest going elsewhere... there are plenty of breakfast places on the same street as the tulip markets. The location was good, a little touristy but we were in the middle of everything. Our experience was enjoyable but I'm not sure I'd recommend the actual hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Travmur
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the NH Schiller - lovely old hotel, got a free upgrade and the room was lovely, faced on a to a busy square but was on a high floor so noise not an issue. Close enough to walk from Centraal station - alternatively tram 9 stops right outside. Around the corner from the hotel is Utrechtstraat - a trendy street with lots of nices cafes, restaurants and shops. Hotel perfect location for exploring Amsterdam - you can walk everywhere from here. Staff were very friendly - would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Darwin66
Reviews.Content: Within the space of 6 months Ive stayed at the Schiller twice and both trips were excellent. Rooms are decent size, nice and clean. Staff at the hotel couldnt do enough to help me with any queries that I had. Perfect base for exploring Amsterdam from, everything within easy walking distance. Smack bang in the middle of Rembrandt square so plenty bars, places to eat and general nightlife. Felt very safe wondering round soaking up the atmosphere at night. Would highly recommend and stay at the Schiller again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam has many hotels to stay in. Don't put this on the list.”
Reviews.Author: Spongegod
Reviews.Content: Okay this hotel really depends on your outlook but put it this way when you check in to some of the the rooms you are given ear plugs!! It is right in the main square and so hellishly noisy. It has a busy ( not too dear) bar right on the street. The beds are comfortable and clean but one night we saw a mouse scuttle through reception! We tried it's sister hotel, the NH Carlton a short walk away and that also suffered hugely from noise as our room faced the main road. Amsterdam is a great city but depending on what you want I would think twice about this hotel. Families should most definitely look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “NH standards”
Reviews.Author: PeripateticJohn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a conference in June 2010. Hotel was up to the usual NH standards, clean, pleasant, adequate in all respects, nothing fancy or particularly elegant, but for a business trip perfectly OK. Location is super, in Rembrandtplein, full of yound people, bars and restaurants. Only real minus is the noise, which I suppose could be a real problem for those staying in lower floors. You can rend a bike from the hotel to move around, which is excellent and you should definitely do.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, but very good:))”
Reviews.Author: Crina S
Reviews.Content: We tried this part of Amsterdam because of a great deal the we got and the location was perfect. It is a very good hotel, with a very helpful staff, but what you have to be aware is that is very noisy. If you get a room with a view to the square, they provide ear plugs on the night stand:)). Also, we got a smoking room with a balcony overlooking the square, it was a nice room, but we had a huge lighted billboard right across the street and it felt like it was day all night :)). The rooms are big, they are according to the standards of NH Hotels in Amsterdam, it is a historic building with very nice common areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: travel_a_ok
Reviews.Content: Staying at the NH Schiller was a good decision in terms of access to the city and proximity to attractions, such as Rembrandt house and Anne Frank's house. We were in rooms that were not facing the main street so they were quiet and relaxing. The neighborhood is totally the opposite during the day versus the night--at night the square comes to life in a way that is unimaginable. The hotel is old and it shows but it's well taken care of. Take a moment to choose the right type of room for you--I picked the standard double and it was the perfect size for me.

Reviews.Title: “The Wonderful World Of NH Schiller Hotel, Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: RonaldoTolareo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NH Schiller Hotel in Amsterdam twice in 2011 and when I have the opportunity to go again...., I will hopefully stay at this Hotel! Everything that could be imagined for a great visit to a city in a foreign country I found here! The location is superb and the view from Suite #217 is Fabulous! The staff is excellent in every way..., and if you need something, anything that will make you "happier" than you already are..., just let someone at the front desk know! The room that I had was Superior, spacious and beautifully decorated. Just to open the windows and breathe in the super refreshing outside air was great! There is none other for me when I travel to Amsterdam, and I hope that you will give this "property" your undivided attention. The Restaurant is also Great! Thanks to All of You at NH Schiller for an unforgettable lifelong experience!!!!! Ron T....USA

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view over the city”
Reviews.Author: karen w
Reviews.Content: Located in Rembrandt square which is my personal favourite location in Amsterdam. The hotel has a beautifull reception area perfect for chilling out. Our room was at the very top of the hotel and although it was small ,the fabulous views over the city ( especially at night ) more than made up for it . Nice mini bar in the room , mmmm sat sipping baileys till daybreak ...heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jan1956
Reviews.Content: We have just got back tonight (Sunday August 28th) from a 4 day stay in the NH Schiller Hotel in Rembrandt Square, Amsterdam. We booked through Expedia and as usual I consulted Trip Advisor and was almost put off by the many reviews saying it was impossible to sleep because of how noisy the street outside the hotel was. We arrived early Thursday morning and the first thing that happened was that the receptionist tried to send us to the sister hotel across the square, the NH Caransa. But we didn't book there, didn't want to go there (it's far more modern and concrete looking, although probably of similar quality) and I always find it far noisier on that side of the square anyway, with the clubs and trams running all night long. My partner insisted we stay where we had booked and we were told that we could, but we would have to wait until 3pm until a room was cleaned and available - he also requested a room at the back of the hotel for quietness. The staff were friendly, polite and helpful throughout our stay, and they took our luggage for us, tagged it and gave us receipts. We didn't have a problem with the extra time to kill as there is so much to do. We went back after 3am and found we had been given a room with a double bed instead of twin beds as we had booked, but it wasn't a problem for us (maybe it would be if friends were sharing instead). The room was lovely, spotlessly clean and quite large, room to walk about and sit (we had room 409), with big windows with blackout curtains right across and overlooking other houses - but a pleasant view, not like the usual backs of hotels where the only view is of metal air-con shafts! There were tea and coffee making facilities, a cool air fan if needed, a wall mounted TV with dozens of channels (including BBCs 1 and 2), a comfy chair and handy side table that you could pull in to yourself for eating, writing or reading, another chair at the desk and lots of bits and pieces - telephone, pen and paper, guide books, extra pillow, blanket, mini bar, fridge, safe etc. The bathroom was lovely, absolutely spotless and modern, a big bath with shower, basin, toilet and lovely clean white towels and complimentary soap, shower gel and shampoo replaced each day. There is also a magnifying mirror with a backlight, a hairdryer and shaving points. Only thing I didn't like was that the toilet tissue was those silly little squares that fall everywhere! But that was the only 'fault'. Now, the bed! The bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in, I wanted to keep it! The bed covers were pristine white, the pillows comfortable and the room was warm enough to not need more than a sheet (although there was a 'summer' duvet). I never heard a sound at all in all the time we were there, no banging doors, people or traffic and no clanky water pipes. No waking up with a bad back - in fact, I went there with a bad back and seriously, it got much better! I have one niggle and that is that the windows have a safety bar across outside to prevent people leaning too far out, but I dread the thought of children leaning out, as they could fall under the bar as it would be above them as it is high, so please be aware and keep the windows closed (the maid opens them sometimes to air the room). We didn't eat at all at the hotel (because we like to try different places), so I can't comment on the food quality, although I did notice that the menu was quite pricey! There is a huge art deco bar and a large lobby with newspapers available and a lovely quiet smaller room where you can sit in peace and watch the square, and directly in front of the window is the famous statue of Rembrandt. There is internet access available and free wifi, you have to ask for the code at the desk. You will be asked for a 50 Euro deposit on your credit card (returnable after your stay) and around 13 Euros (to date) city tax. I absolutely loved our stay here, it was quiet, relaxed, very central to everything and I will most definitely stay again as soon as possible. (I have not been offered any discounts for this review (as has been in the press recently) and have no connection to the hotel or anyone innvolved with it, please see my other reviews).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but noisy area”
Reviews.Author: Jampot80
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is excellent; the staff are very friendly and accommodating and the room was spacious and cleaned daily. Rembrandtplein is a great location and it is easy to explore the city from there - lots of regular trams and rickshaws all around (the rickshaws are great fun and only cost approx 6 euro per person to Dam Square). There are some good restaurants locally and a great pub on the same side as the Schiller - The Old Bell is definitely worth a visit. My only gripe is the noise; if your room is at the front of the hotel the noise from the square is horrific at times! Even the ear plugs kindly provided by the hotel aren't enough to stop the bass from the nearby clubs rattling your windows! Great if you're in your 20's and want to party all night but not so great for old fogies like me!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, just an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mr-Traveler75
Reviews.Content: Nice location and very central in the city with great welcome on arriving. The room was certainly on the small side but accomodated everything needed. Good shower and the mattress was nice but the two choices of pillows available were awful. We were situated at the rear of the hotel and VERY thankful for this, due to the VERY loud square that Rembantplein is with all the clubs and coffeehouses that have excpetionally loud music at weekends. Overall, we found this hotel to be very average and with no free wifi and complementary water, when paying around â‚¬180 per night, we would certainly look for a better value hotel the next time visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great building, shame about the breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: quacking
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 120 at the back of the hotel from friday to monday inclusive. I asked for a quiet room because we had read that the Schiller could be a little bit noisy. However, friday night was still a bit sleepless due to loud music from nearby club coming up the fire escape which was very close to our room. Also, when the daytime shift clocked on early in the morning we could hear them singing, laughing and joking with each other (again due to the fire escape) for about 15 minutes - presumably before they started work properly, when all was quiet again. Saturday night was better from the music point of view - though i had resorted to ear-plugs, kindly supplied by the hotel! - but the staff problem still remained. Sunday and monday nights were fine - no noise issues at all. As far as breakfast is concerned, beware of the fruit salad selection as we encountered problems: e.g. flies on the fruit, hairs on the fruit and contamination with the fish selection. It would be a great help if they simply put the fruit in a covered container. On the plus side, the hotel is in a great place to explore the wonderful city of amsterdam - right in the middle of everything. also, the actual building is really nice as is the interior decor, and the staff were unfailingly polite and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pookmel
Reviews.Content: Our room was small but had all the amenities. It was spotlessly clean. The breakfast was delicious with a nice variety of choices. The hotel itself is a feast for your eyes if you like the Art Deco style. It was centrally located and a short distance from all major attractions. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeanvabu
Reviews.Content: I truly loved staying at the Schiller. It is right on Rembantplein and has a terrific early 1900's feel to it. That's not saying the rooms aren't modern. They have been upgraded but not all the way. The internet connections we not up to our standards (30 min free wi-fi in lobby only or pay for wired connection in room) and the lack of a cooling system was a detractor as well. We were warned that our room would most likely be noisy as we were on the street side of the hotel and it was! Partying went on until 5AM! With all of these negatives I still loved the place and would go again. However, I would ask for a room in the back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Frequentravel-her
Reviews.Content: Fantastic view! Rooms were wonderful... A little noisy, in the heart of Amsterdam. Opened my window to an evening concert in the park below. Enjoyed outside cafe style dining. Walkable to everything you want to see & do. Would definitely stay again, but be prepared to shell out 150+ Euros per night, but not expensive for a luxury suite in Amsterdam. Free internet in lobby

Reviews.Title: “zero for schiller hotel”
Reviews.Author: delfina46
Reviews.Content: Unpleasant stuff .. very rude especially at the reception, with the hotel manager Mrs. Calissa .. the breakfast away from high category bufette in N.H. HOTELS line.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Bobmal7
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two night stay at the Schiller. I have mixed feelings about this hotel. First the positives: 1) Location, location, location!! It is situated on a beautiful city square that leaves you within walking distance of many of the main attractions in Amsterdam - Anne Frank house (10-15 minute walk); Heineken tour (15 minute walk); Red light district (10-15 minute walk); the flower market (5 minute walk). Just bring your walking shoes and you can cover a lot of ground and sights out of this hotel - no need to even jump on the trams which are also conveniently located in the square. 2) They have a very good brasserie restaurant and a separate bar also attched to the hotel. 3) Hotel was booked a t a good price point considering it's central location. The negatives: 1) The hotel does not have air conditioning. This in itself is not an issue BUT if you are on the front side of the hotel (which is where the noise is) it could be problematic. I also noticed that the room did not have a thermostat SO I would imagine that in the winter you have very little control of the radiators in the room. 2) I asked for a "quiet" room and found myself on the 5th floor in a very small and dated room - carpeting looked like it had been in place for 50 years - not appealing at all. However - it was QUIET and I did get a good night's sleep. 3) requested a wake up call on both mornings of my stay and received NONE!! Thankfully I woke up on my own and was not late for either my meeting on the first day or my flight back home on the second day. This could have been disastrous!! Would I stay here again or recommend this hotel? Probably not BUT if you are looking for location and understand the other downsides, the Schiller will be adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room but an issue with noise”
Reviews.Author: lukepgl
Reviews.Content: First off- great location. We were in Amsterdam and didn't need to take a tram once- we just walked everywhere! The staff were friendly and welcoming and managed to overcome our first issue, where my friend had only been given a single rather than a double room, quickly and efficiently. My room (121) was clean, modern and spacious- it made a good first impression apart from the rather poor view. Unfortunately I got an appalling nights sleep the first night as the club next door seemed to be piping their bass heavy techno music directly into my room. I'm not overly fussy with noise but this was at a level where my trusty ear plugs plus noise cancelling headphones combo was barely touching it. When I complained on the second night I got moved to a much smaller but much quieter room on the 5th floor. Again, I can't fault the service but I still struggle to imagine how anyone in that room could put up with it, unless they one of the people that were actually in the club (and from looking in the window I definitely wouldn't want to be one of those people). Overall though, no regrets about our choice and would recommend it if, like us, location is one of the driving factors in your decision.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location but kinda loud at night.”
Reviews.Author: drkmono
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and friendly staff. Had a problem with our shower head and lamps which were fixed promptly after mentioning to reception. Great location near the city center on a vibrant square. The only issue was the noise at night, we were on the side facing the square (not sure how loud it is on the other side of the hotel) As the weather was hot (and no AC in the room) we needed to have the window open slightly, so the noise was a bit of an issue. That said, still had a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Sprinchun
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the best area, between red light district and jordaan shopping area. In addition, there are a lot of restaurants within 5 minutes walking. I recommend you to buy the museums tickets in the hotel lobby to avoid long qeues. However, the outside rooms, which have beAutiful views of the Rembrandt Square, are noisy. In addition, you must pay if you need internet in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: lozza1986
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the NH Schiller 17th Feb 2011 for my Husbands 30th. This hotel has Good service, nice rooms, fantastic breakfast and within 10 mins walk of whatever you want to see in the City! Some things close by that we made sure we went to see were: - Sex Museum - Quite funny to see, good value considering its â‚¬4.00 entry fee :-) Amsterdam Dungeons - worth a visit, Iâ€™m a bit of a wimp so I thought it was quite scary haha! Torture Museum - not worth the â‚¬7.50 entry fee! Anne Franks House & Heineken Factory - definitely worth a visit. We also experienced some of the nightlife whilst we were there, the club Escape is directly opposite the hotel, â‚¬15.00 entry, real expensive drinks, they charge you if you require using their toilets which I thought was a little cheeky and the music wasn't the best I have heard whilst out clubbing. Considering this is suppose to be one of Amsterdamâ€™s best clubs I wasn't too impressed but this could be to do with us being used to us living in one of the UK's clubbing hotspots. The Coffee shop which is next door to the hotel is really good, they also have good snacks and drinks just incase you get the munchies! All in all my conclusion of Amsterdam... Brilliant! Youâ€™ve got to try it at least once in your lifetime! I probably wouldnâ€™t come back myself as it's another one marked off the tick list but if I were to return I would 100% be happy to stay at the NH Schiller.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Amsterdam nightlife”
Reviews.Author: bdk418
Reviews.Content: If you're coming to the city to enjoy the clubs, pubs and "coffee houses", this is a perfect location. They are all right outside your door in the Rembrandtplein area. It is also easy to get around the city from this area. Our hotel room was enormous by European standards. And, as part of the NH chain, if you are unsatisfied with it, they will connect you to another of their many hotels in Amsterdam. Our problem with the Hotel was the noise from the street. When we checked in and were shown the room by a person from reception, we asked about the noise. They said that because we were on the 4th floor, it was no problem. Clearly, that person had not ever slept on the fourth floor! I am a light sleeper and was not able to get to sleep until 1:30 a.m. or so, even though we were there mid-week. Other than that issue, we were pleased with the room and the breakfast they provided - a varied and nice range of food. We would have preferred internet access in our room, rather than having to use it in the lobby, but that was something we faced in other cities as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to see all of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: slsnyc
Reviews.Content: Located right on Rembrandtplein, this hotel is the absolute perfect location for exploring Amsterdam. It's walking distance to practically everything in the city. We were there in the winter (freezing!) and also appreciated its proximity to key tram lines. We had a nice quiet room in the back of the hotel - clean and a nice size for a European hotel room. The little perk we loved the most was the in-room tea service. It was so nice to come in from the cold each day and be able to make a hot cup of tea. The hotel restaurant, Brasserie Schiller, was also a very nice surprise. Our guide books listed it as a recommendation, but I'm sometimes skeptical of anything recommended to tourists. You just never know... But we tried it one night and had a delicious meal. If you stay here (or even if you don't), do not miss the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Emsy123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel over the Christmas period for a few days. The hotel was lovely - the room was clean and tidy and was cleaned and the sheets changed every day. A lovely bathroom with a good sized bath, and a tv that picked up plenty of channels. The staff asked us when we arrived if we wanted a back or front room - the Winter Wonderland was still out the front of the hotel and so we asked for a back room - it was really quiet. If you're a light sleeper and you think you might get woken up by noise from the square then ask for a back room. A lovely hotel, the staff were really helpful and it has a really nice atmosphere. We'd definitely go back and stay there again. The only extra thing to note that isn't entirely obvious is that you'll be asked to leave a 50 Euro deposit on arrival. If you do it by debit card they'll give your deposit back in cash when you check out, but they will charge the City Tax when you leave (which isn't huge, but good to know it's going to happen!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: giliorshoko
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well kept, the room was large enough and was rearranged every day of our stay. The front desk staff were very nice, upon checkin we were asked if we want a front or rear facing room to avoid the squares noise. Also we were told checkout time is only on 17:00 (no late checkout fee) which was excellent for us. Breakfest was good, again very nice hotel staff. In the lobby there is half an hour free internet service. And it's location is great! Tram no. 9 which arrives straight from the central station, and also walking distance from Kalvastraat, and other major attraction.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very well run Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: scunnybunny78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Schiller for the last week of November 2010. The rooms are spotlessly clean and well equipped, the staff are very professional and courtoeus without being stuffy and mechanical. Nothing was too much trouble and they are a credit to the hotel. While I was staying, there was the 'Winterland' running outside in Rembrandt square which was noisy, while this didn't bother me as I can sleep through pretty much anything, If you are a light sleeper then you would probably be better asking for a room at the back of the hotel as Rembrandtplein can be noisy as it is one of Amsterdam's nightlife centres. This was offered to me and explained on check-in so I was able to make the choice (but I left the quiet rooms for people who can not sleep through an earthquake as I have done in the past). Other than the point above, which if you are socialising in Amsterdam will not be a problem either! I cannot fault the Schiller at all. An excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: oscar42o
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great place. The location, the staff, and the food are great. A little pricy but it is Europe and the European idea of hotel versus US idea are a little different. WIth that in mind the cleanliness was good enough. NO BED BUGS here. The towels were changed daily as was the bedding. The only issue is: the noise. We had a great room overlooking the square and it was fun. However, after the second night of no sleep (I'm not as young as I used to be) we requested to move rooms. There was no issue regarding this. The staff had us in a new room on the same floor within seconds. They even came to help us move our things over. Once in the new room we slept like babies. No free wi-fi. But the computer worked fine. Great eating close by. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Bad value. Avoid.”
Reviews.Author: ekehat
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good: Good central location at Rembrandtplein which is a nightlife center. Good breakfast was included in the price. Staff was courteous. Now for all the reasons to avoid: The location also meant loud noise until 2am. Let's just say that the hotel was considerate enough to put earplugs in the room. The room itself was of a fair size, but had serious electricity problems, with lights coming suddenly off, or not turning on at all. The hotel sent an electrician who managed to fix it - until the problems started again the very next day. The hotel is trying to save on the wrong staff: very few towels, a single bar of soap, and a short supply of toilet paper. WiFi in the rooms and lobby, but very expensive (more than 10 EUR per day). In summary, not really bad, but definitely not worth the price either. Next time in Amsterdam I'm going to look for something better.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, good value, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: 2IowaGals
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation at the Schiller with some hesitation after reading reviews that emphasized the nighttime noisiness of Rembrandtplien's cafe and disco culture. But the location was great and a signficant online discount drew me in. I requested a back room, which I ineed got, and noise was never an issue. In fact, I had a lovely view of the city skyline. The size of the room was small, of course, by US standards, but fairly typical for one-person rooms I've experienced in Europe. It was very clean and housekeeping did an excellent job every day tidying things up. A very large window--that opened--along with a transom--kept the air moving, so the lack of air conditioning wasn't a problem (and I like my rooms cool!). The breakfast (that came with my room fee) was outstanding: hot foods (eggs, sausage, pancakes, etc.), many breads, fresh fruit, yougurts, cold cuts and cheeses, salads, muesili, etc. were plentiful, and a lovely way to start the day. The people working the front desk were attentive, learned my name, and very hospitable. When a morning wake-up call failed to come one day, they were very apologetic and made sure that mistake did not happen again. The decor--in the rooms and the lobby--were neutral and fine; the cafe (where the breakfast is served) classical Amsterdam Art Deco. Adding to the value for me was the hotel's location--very close to the city center, right on 2 key tram lines, with lovely restaurants nearby and a great grocery store just a block away. My only real complaint is that they do not provide free wireless. All in all, a very positive experience. Now, I wouldn't pay rack rate for the hotel; but then again, I never do. So look for an online discount, make your requirements known, and I bet you'll find it a pleasurable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly & helpful staff..”
Reviews.Author: shania201010
Reviews.Content: Went with a group of 7 people. the hotel was clean,modern enough and the staff were very helpfull. My room was quiet and the beds were comfy. Had loads of channels like uk which was great. bathroom was clean. Only thing was that i have bites on my legs which I think are bed bugs... noone else in the room got them so I dont know. We were beside a bars and clubs but we couldnt hear a thing the room we were in but my other friends said it was quite noisy out the front. Overall the hotel and location was perfect. We were happy with the service, and it was reasonable too. Also nearly everywhere we went we had to pay 50cent to use the toilets! Would go again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Lovely Rooms, Rubbish Air Con”
Reviews.Author: PamelaxM
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for the weekend of the world cup... fab location couldnt fault it! Noisy outside but we asked for a room at the back and top floor to ensure a view...this was provided for us with no problems... Check in was ok, charged our card for $50 incase we used the mini bar... would prefer the choice to pay when we used it and not before to be honest but no huge deal. Found the staff to be sometimes rude and not really interested in what we had to say whether it be looking for directions or enquiring about a late check out... One massive complaint i have about this hotel is the air con.. or lack of it i should say! The room was awful with how hot it was.... they had one small fan in the room which done absolutely nothing apart from circulate hot air. It really was unbearable... look into another hotel if u are travelling through the summer months. To be honest i should have thought and checked before i booked!! Other than that the hotel was nice, modern and easy to get to places! Wouldnt recommend in the summer months but maybe through the winter!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: aardvark59
Reviews.Content: we went with freinds to celebrate my wife and my mates birthday . The rooms were very comfortable with a view over the square. easy to walk everywhere. The bacon for breakfast was a bit scrappy but everything else was great

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star Hotel! Expensive for low quality”
Reviews.Author: ROG3
Reviews.Content: The hotel had no record of our reservation and were not particularly helpful on coming up with a solution. Eventually I had to cart my bags off to their sister ship, NH Doeden, which was an equivalent. Rooms - No aircon, low quality, I would classify as low 3 star. Did not reflect the price that we paid. Though admitedly I believe this may be a common symptom of the quality of Amsterdam hotels generally. Life - 1 tiny lift serving all floors, didn't really work. Quite noisy, though admitedly this is offset by the fact that it is a great central location. Staff were very friendly, welcoming and helpful. Small room. Didn't feel like a 4 star what so ever.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic---------June 2010-------Co. Derry & Co. Donegal ,Ireland”
Reviews.Author: suzzimck
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the 26th June and stayed for 3 Nights, Hotel is Beautiful and Historic inside , rooms are very modern , location is brill , if located at the front of the hotel it is noisy, but the view is good . back of hotel your looking at walls which is not nice ,we changed to the front of the hotel after the first night , as all we heard were birds hitting off the windows which believe me was very annoying . Hotel is easy walking distance to everything , only thing , when you arrive they take â‚¬50 cash off you for the mini bar in room + â‚¬15 tax. which is not stated when booking . Other wise could not fault this hotel , as staff are more than helpfull. we would without a thought consider this hotel again, Had the best time , great nightlife , great food, great sights, but expensive , so take plenty of money with you ..........

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, but too noisy at night!”
Reviews.Author: PennyandCrystal
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable, staff were accomodating, paintings and art all lovely, but I must say we were not impressed with noisy Rembrandtplein at night. The area is full of intoxicated people and loud music well into the morning hours. It is centrally located and a nice area to visit during the day, but we will stay in the Jordan or another area near Vondel park in the future. I would recommend it if noise isn't a factor or if you plan to be out late a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Hotspot in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sharatan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NH Schiller for one night in May. The hotel is ideally located at Rembrandtplein in the heart of a very lively neighbourhood. It's still within walking distance from Amsterdam's main train station (15 minutes). The tram from the train station stops directly at Rembrandt Square in front of the hotel. With some of the reviews in mind I asked for a room on the backside of the hotel which indeed is the much quieter side. Room: The room was clean and had a decent size. It featured the typical modern appearance of the NH Hotels with flatscreen TV and WiFi access for a fee (Swisscom). Breakfast: The breakfast buffet is very decent, nothing fancy but it should have something for agreat variety of tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Beekeeperone
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very central location in Amsterdam. You can easily reach most of Amsterdam by foot from here. A tram stops directly across Rembrandplatz to take you further afield if needed. There were many trendy bars and eating places within steps of the hotel. The rooms were clean and neat and nicely decorated. The bathroom was large with 2 sinks, a great shower and a soaking tub. The breakfasts (included in the room price) were excellent and consisted of typical European breakfast foods. The elevator was fairly small and more than 2 people with all their luggage was about max load. The hotel clerks all spoke English plus several other languages. Although they seemed happy to assist me, they were not in any hurry to do so! Slow service but with a smile. Internet access was free for 15 minutes but required a code from desk staff. We received 2 nights here along with the purchase of our airline tickets so I am not sure of the value but I would stay there again if ever in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: KathleenBridget
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay in the NH Schiller and were very impressed with the service and attitude of the staff. Check-in was relatively easy although I am not sure why every member of the party had to fill in a registration form! As a group of nine we were concerned that we would not be able to sit together at breakfast but this was sorted and a table was reserved for us each morning. Every member of staff was helpful and on the day we checked out we met the manager who made a point of asking about our stay which was a nice touch. We did request twin rooms at the back of the hotel but, this was not possible, despite an e-mail saying it would be done. However, we were given on room as an upgrade and, had we wanted to, we could have waited until some more twin rooms were available later on. It was our choice to take the doubles and just settle in. Lovely to have tea and coffee facilities and a decent fridge/minibar. All in all, an excellent stay and very convenient. We caught the Hotel shuttle bus but next time, with a smaller party, i would catch the train from the airport as there is a tram stop opposite the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel - too noisy to sleep in at night”
Reviews.Author: AlexBig
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel in a nice location. Unfortunately, the nightclubs opposite are so noisy that the rooms are very loud at night. Even with earplugs (bring them yourselves - they are not provided!) it is not possible to sleep. The windows are not double glazed so the management have made no attempt to reduce this noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent Hotel but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: CloudPixie
Reviews.Content: My main whinge would be that we booked through a website on a pre paid rate, and despite me calling the hotel three times to verify when they would charge my card, and they eventually did, four days before arrival, they asked us to pay again upon arrival! Once they had checked and realised that we had in fact paid it, there was no apology regarding the mix up. The rooms are clean and tidy, ours had a lovely view of the square - overlooking the Escape Club which rages until about 3am. Our friends that we were with had the courtyard view room and there was very quiet. That aside the other reception staff (that didn't try to double charge us) were very helpful and the room was a great size for Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after our original hotel was cancelled and was more than happy with the result ! A great location, set in a really nice square with lots of bars to choose from. Would recommend this hotel for a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable modern base for exploring Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Magenmic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the NH Schiller in Rembrandtplein for three nights. Because of the reviews I had read I asked on arrival at reception for a 'quiet' room and we were given room 108 at the back of the hotel on the first floor. We had booked online and got a special three nights for two deal, including breakfast. This is great value because the buffet breakfast is a fantastic start to the day. I had brought my laptop but discovered that to use it I would have to get a 10euro voucher for 24 hour usage. (I think this is a a bit mean. If there is wireless available, why not let residents use it at their own discretion? )I had difficulty using the oucher to connect, but found the reception staff were very helpful. You can also ask for a free 15minute voucher to use on their own computer (one voucher for your stay). The tram stop is just opposite the hotel and this is very convenient. It was raining some of the time we were there (late February) and it was great to be able to 'pop' back to the hotel to our cosy room at intervals. A down-side if you like a late night drink or just want to chill out in the lounge, is that the bar/restaurant area (very nice art deco) closed its doors at around 10.30, but of course there is plenty activity outside the Rembrandtplein itself. This picked up at the weekend, and on the Saturday night we enjoyed the benefit of being at the back of the hotel as we heard the muffled sounds of entertainment late into the night (we did have our window open too). We would definitely go back here when visiting again if we got the same deal - roughly 80 euro a night for the two of us including a delicious breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and great hotel for solo or group travel”
Reviews.Author: inmybag
Reviews.Content: I love the location of this hotel because all of Amsterdam is walkable from here. 10-15 min walk north to Dam Square, Central Station, inner circle activities. Also 10-15 min walk south to Museum Square (Van Gogh, Rijk). There is an AH grocery to-go down the street (ask the front desk) and the tram stops across the square. As a solo female traveler, I felt very safe in the hotel and walking in the nearby area. I rarely took the tram because walking was a more enjoyable way to experience the city. I was surprised that the bar in the hotel/restaurant closed before 11:00 at night. There are of course many options nearby, but would have been nice to have a nightcap within the hotel. I was concerned about noise from previous reviews so requested a room on the back side of the hotel. I slept soundly every night of the stay. The rooms are clean, simple, and efficient. Staff is very nice, but details are sometimes missed but I think these details get missed at most hotels in Amsterdam, e.g. they didn't call a taxi for me for an early morning departure as I'd requested, but I'd planned extra time in case this fell through knowing it was likely. I also thought the soap and shower gel were very poor quality and not effective at removing the grime and stink of days of sightseeing. There is a pillow menu, safe, hairdryer, hot water kettle and minibar. TV included about 3 BBC channels and much of the Dutch television was subtitled American programming. Although it is an older building, there is a lift. The free 15 mins of Internet daily was helpful for quick research and printing confirmations. This NH hotel was at least 25 euro cheaper than the other NH hotel across the square and almost 50 euro cheaper than other NH hotels in Amsterdam. Because it was so "cheap", I was apprehensive, but I would stay here again and recommend it to friends based on location, rooms, and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Buzz at Rembrandt Square”
Reviews.Author: Herr55Pdog
Reviews.Content: Prime location and the previously unheard of rate I got (even for a Sunday) was unbeatable for a top class hotel near central Amsterdam. The staff was excellent, and if you appreciate classy, old style surroundings this is probably one of the best hotel choices to consider. Not "stuffy" at all.The single room was small, but multi-tiered in a cool, funky design. Bathroom was tiny, but for someone alone on business/pleasure it was plenty. Good bars, restaurants, and "cafes" right next door, great canal views/walks one or two blocks away. Approximately 10-15 minute walk from "Dam" square/red lights, or Van Gogh Museum area in another direction. Parking (unavailable here) is expensive and tricky as usual in Amsterdam, but there's another NH nearby that offered parking with comparably (area-wise) reasonable rates (40 euro per day, less than most central streets or garages). This is an excellent location for anyone in town for a concert at Paradiso (10-15 min walk through interesting locales), and I will definitely try to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Well Situated and Well Designed”
Reviews.Author: ArgentineTango
Reviews.Content: The rooms were excellent, a good size and very well furnished. The bed was comfortable and the linen and towels were clean and changed regularly. It is important to ask for a room away from the main square. The first room I was given was on the square and it was too noisy, but I was moved on request to a much quieter room at the back. The breakfast was excellent, a good range of products and really good quality fresh bread and meat. We did not eat in the restaurant but did have drinks one evening and it's a lovely venue with some beautiful artwork. The hotel was amazingly well situated for our needs. We could walk to the Van Gogh Museum very quickly, and also to more central places so we hardly used public transport at all. Rembrandplein is very well equipped with bars and restaurants. The hotel staff were friendly and efficient and helped us with cinema times as well as locating some of the places we needed. Gurdip (who worked in the bar) was particularly helpful. I'd definitely recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, great restaurant, loud at night”
Reviews.Author: ATL101
Reviews.Content: I went over Thanksgiving holiday and selected this hotel because of it's location and reviews. I was very happy to get a first floor balcony (smoking) room. My double room was a bit smaller than the other on the first floor but I was a solo traveler. It was perfect for me. Room was very clean, bathroom large and clean. I loved the double doors that opened up to the patio. Had one meal of Salmon in the restaurant and it was excellent! The only down to this hotel is the club next door plays VERY loud music late at night...I mean loud. If it weren't for that it would be perfect. Oh, and there was a computer with free internet for guests near the elevator. I'll proably stay there again...just wish that club would turn down the jams a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for young people”
Reviews.Author: nadalert
Reviews.Content: Hi, I just returned from this hotel after staying for 3 nights. I had requested a smoking room in advance (which is difficult to find in Amsterdam) which we were allocated on check in. We had a room on the first floor with a nice balcony overlooking the Rembrandsplein square. The room is perfect size with a flat screen tv and a good selection of english channels but no pay per view movies. The hotel is very well located with restaurants and clubs all outside the door! I would say it is more suited to young people as it is quite loud at night time if you are in a room facing the square. It is a 5 minute walk to Dam's square where you can do shopping and sight seeing. I would recommend the hop on hop off bus tour and would also recommend Lucius seafood restaurant. All in all, a great stay and fun weekend!

Reviews.Title: “the spot to be at!!!!”
Reviews.Author: junie125
Reviews.Content: cant ask for a better location if you like to party...coffee shop right next door, plenty of clubs, bars and restaurants within one block radius. staff was nice and hotel very classy. i will not stay anywhere else when i return to amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “good location with a nice enjoyable square”
Reviews.Author: chipman75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 19th of September till 22th of September 2009.It was a nice hotel and the rooms are very large for the Europian standarts.The location is good and it can be thought as city center hotel since it was just 5-10 min. walk to Dam Square.We have not tried the restaurant of the hotel so I can not comment on the food satff.But I can tell you that the breakfast is good enough to make you happy.One day we had a problem with the room.We found a small insect in the bed and told this to the staff in the reception and the manager took the responsibility and offer to change the room immediately If we like to do or they will clean and check all the room again. We want them just to check the room and when we turn back at night we find an apologize letter from the manager and 3 apples and a bottle of water.That was kind .You can go to this hotel.Nice location,Nice staff,Nice service.What can you want More?

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Olde Worlde Charm!”
Reviews.Author: topgran
Reviews.Content: We were directed to this hotel as our first choice was overbooked and we were told this was to be our hotel for our long weekend. Initially, we were not pleased but on arrival at the said hotel, what a surprise. Lots of old paintings (if you like that sort of thing) but the staff on reception were fantastic. Always helpful and nothing too much trouble. The rooms we were given were superior rooms due to being inconvenienced and they certainly were! On the 6th floor with a balconly overlooking Rembrandht Square. We had a meal in the restaurant and the service and the meal was first class. We found out the next day it was the number one eating place in Amsterdam. The only complaint I had was, on the last day, the breakfast was cold. This was due to a large party who were also leaving that day and everyone seem to have descended on the dining room at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - no air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: bezzaact
Reviews.Content: It was quite warm when we stayed here but there is no air conditioning. We slept with the windows open but, even though we were in a room at the back, it was very noisy. Our room was very small, we didn't have room to leave both suitcases out, one had to be closed and stashed in a corner. Great location, very central.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: dyonysios
Reviews.Content: We've become quite fond of the NH chain of hotels around Europe, they offer good value for money and there are usually no major unpleasant surprises in store. So when my girlfriend and I needed to spend an overnight in Amsterdam we made a booking at the NH Tropen. Arriving at the hotel we found it a little out of the way although in a beautifully green district, near the Tropical Gardens, Zoo and so on. We wanted however to be somewhere more central and to be able to explore historic Amsterdam on foot so the girl at Reception was very helpful and actually transferred our booking to another property, the NH Schiller on Rembrandtplein, at the same price and without any fee or surcharge! The Schiller is in an older building with a turn-of-the-century feel to the lobby (19th - 20th obviously, not 20th - 21st!). It gives on to a rectangular plaza with a statue of Rembrandt, tramlines, cafes, two more NH Hotels some restaurants and so on. Are you surprised at there being three NH hotels on one square? They have thirteen in Amsterdam and there's not really a lot of space to spread them around! Back to the neighbourhood, shops and restaurants and even cinemas abound in the lanes that lead from the square and 5 minutes to the south or east will find you strolling along the famous canals, looking into houseboats and trying not to get run over by strange half-bicycle-half-wheelbarrow contraptions. Our room was not particularly spacious but it was comfortable and spotless. As with quirky older buildings, sometimes the ensuite bathroom is actually larger than the actual bedroom which was almost the case here. Everything was clean and well cared for but pretty old. A nice touch were the little sweeties they'd placed on the pillows and the desk and a book of short stories actually compiled and published by the hotel chain, on the bedside table. To sum up, we were satisfied with our stay. We didn't try the breakfast as we had an early morning flight the next day but if up to the usual standards for this chain I'm sure it would have been perfectly acceptable. A little surprise was when we asked room-service for some ice and drinking glasses they said they would charge us if they had to bring it up but it was free if we went down to the restaurant and fetched it ourselves. And a word of warning if you get a room that actually faces on to the Rembrandtplein: there is a MASSIVE advertising LED display on the building opposite that is on all night and that the very heavy curtains only barely manage to block out. Without the curtains it will burn your silhouette onto the wall behind you or blind you like those interregation lamps in a prison somewhere!

Reviews.Title: “An ode to hotel joy”
Reviews.Author: DoeHEAD
Reviews.Content: The Schiller is a grand dame of a hotel from another era, situated on one of Amsterdam's liveliest squares. Its public rooms have a gentlemen's-clubby feel, and the sugarcube elevator just off the lobby barely has enough room for two people with luggage. That being said, our room was contemporary and comfortable, with a spacious bathroom and well-stocked mini-fridge. Even the hotel staff, which was no doubt strained to its limits during the lunatic pandemonium of Queens Day, handled our visit with calm professionalism. When one can get to them, the Flower Market, the Herrengracht, the Amstel, the Munt Plein and the Opera House are all within short walking distance. And, except for transitless Queens Day, the number 4, 9 and 14 trams run directly past the hotel's front door. The Schiller is a great value in a superb location.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, old fashined hotel with charm”
Reviews.Author: Happyholiday29
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Amsterdam in Jan 09 for three days and chose this hotel with the help of Tripadvisor and it was perfect for our needs. We had a room overlooking the square and I loved sitting in my window seat looking at the passers-by and listening to the trams. The bar was really traditional and the bar men real characters. My only complaint would be that the bar and restaurant cosed at 11pm prompt but we thought our room was comfortable and would return to this hotel on another visit. The location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “One little nit pick”
Reviews.Author: MrJohnMd
Reviews.Content: A wonderful stay of 7 nights. I loved the place. Exqusite decor and surroundings. A great location. At least in the off months. I reserve judgement on staying there in the summer until I have done it. The staff was excellent. Professional and helpful. The room and bed I had was fine. Although two beds pushed together might not work out the best for honeymooners. A nice 25% reduction on breakfast buffett at least thru Feb. 14 euro instead of 19. Ask for a chit at the desk for your discount. The 15 mins, at a time, of free computer usage is a nice touch. My one little gripe comes from the english tv selection they have. Hard to believe I would even mention it. But a 4 star business hotel catering to english speakers should have at least one or maybe two full time news channels. BBC? CNN? You can get english TV stations. Its just that they are a mish mash of quirky stations showing not all that popular sitcoms for the most part. In this day and age a 24 hour news station is not to much to ask. But other than that the hotel was just about prefect. At least for the great priceline price I got.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but staff should be trained”
Reviews.Author: Reureu
Reviews.Content: This hotel gave me the following impression Good points: -Location -Noise (due to the location, but only if your room is facing the Rembrandt Square. The rooms at the back of the hotel are reasonably quiet). -Cleanliness -Room price (without extras) -Temperature. My room was quite cold in spite of the heating. I realised that the windows did not have double-glazing. Bad points: -The price of all extras (breakfast, mini-bar, internet connection, ...) -The staff should receive a proper training (see below) During my stay at the Schiller, I had the following problem: 1. My colleague and myself were assigned to the wrong rooms. I was in 309 and he was in 409, although it was the other way around in the system. 2. The only drink I had at the bar was charged to my colleague's room (easily explained by point 1) 3. When my colleague checked out, he paid for my drink as I agreed that I did have it. But the staff tried to charge me again for it. 4. We had a power cut on my floor, which was due to an FI-switch which went down. It took them around 25 minutes to flick it back on, which is a long time. 5. My colleague gave them some clothes for dry-cleaning, and instead of actually cleaning them, they placed them in the storage room, as the receptionist did not know the process to send clothes to dry-cleaning. All the problems above could be easily solved if the staff had been trained properly.

Reviews.Title: “It's gezellig...and that's a good thing.”
Reviews.Author: RenaissanceGirl
Reviews.Content: To get to the heart of it, I'd say that the Schiller strikes a lovely balance between old world charm and new school conveniences. If you like some character in a hotel but also want the perks that accompany a remodeled room, this could be the place for you. The 1910 building has lots of endearing details like the stained glass window in the stairwell, the pillars supporting the arched ceiling in the lobby, and the beautiful but slightly slick marble staircase. The elevator is small compared American counterparts but large enough for a couple of people and their luggage. We were given a room on the first floor that had a balcony overlooking Rembrandtsplein. There is an unfortunately huge and bright neon billboard on the other side of the plaza but the heavy red curtains in our room blocked out the glow at night. There was some noise from the nightclub nearby, but it didn't keep us up at night and we chalked it up to the price of a cental location. Two large glass doors lead out to the balcony, which had a table and two chairs. The room was adaquately sized...no room for cartwheels but the two of us could move around without feeling too cramped. There was a desk, two nightstands with lamps, two chairs, and an end table. The bed had a large painting for the headboard which spiced up the room a bit. The armoire was small but efficient with lots of deep shelves, space to hang coats and a safe for valuables. There was a small electric kettle for heating up water for tea or instant coffee. The bathroom was larger than expected (as we have found many European bathrooms to be roughly the size of a hall closet!). The bathtub was 3/4 the size of a typical one. The showerhead and water supply was fantstic. Endless steaming hot water and very high pressure. There was a pedestal sink and nice long ledge to put toiletries on. The location was fantastic. Super easy to get to from the train station; trolly 4 or 9 will stop right across the plaza from the hotel. We got to museumplein and Dam Square easily using the trolleys and never had to transfer. There were lots of good restaurant choices on Utrechtsestraat, a street that lead off the plaza on the right as you exit the hotel. Cute little plaza, decorated with Christmas lights during our December stay and complete with Rembrandt statue and waffle stand. We didn't eat at the restaurant since it was a bit pricy and did not need internet service so I can't comment on these aspects. I reserved our room late and got a good price; I would probably be less enthusiastic at the regular plrice but it would still be a decent hotel choice given it's location and charm. We had a very nice two night stay at the Schiller and would probably stay there again if we return to Amsterdam. Oh, and gezellig is Dutch for "creating an atmosphere that allows good times to happen".

Reviews.Title: “Xmas In Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: nottshammer
Reviews.Content: We (me my wife) stayed in this hotel from Xmas eve for 4 nights and it served us perfectly. The advice given on this site by other reviewers regarding requesting a room at the back of the hotel, was spot on. We got such a room (309) which did look out over the back and it was lovely and peaceful. The front of the hotel looks out over Rembrandt Sq, which would have been very noisy at xmas time and does have loads of flashing lights. Our room was excellent for the two of us, being recently redecorated, with a comfy king sized bed and with good bathroom. The hotel staff were all very helpful (even though they were working over xmas holiday!) and the breakfast was very nice too. The Breakfast room/ bar/restaurant is a fine sight, with lots of lovely old panelling. All told, the pictures on the hotel web site really do it justice. Best thing of course, was the excellent location of the hotel. It was was in easy walking distance of all the main attractions. I would also recommend Amsterdam as an excellent Xmas destination, as all the museums, bars & restaurants (but not the shops) are open all xmas eve/day/boxing day. Walking around the deserted canals, on a bright sunny xams day was a true joy. The exchange rate made eating and drinking a bit steep but that's not Amsterdam's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Heart of the Entertainment District”
Reviews.Author: CoronaBoy
Reviews.Content: Stayted at this hotel room for 3 nights. The hotel is located in the famous Rembrandt Square. This hotel is a very chic French like hotel and is sorrunded by bars and night clubs along with shopping. The arrival was very easy and inexpensive. Just take the #4 or #9 trolly from the central station and your there within 10 minutes. The trolly drops you off right in front of the hotel. The front staff were very friendly. Initially they gave me a room on the first floor with a very bad view and smoke smell. Upon request, they changed the room for me with no hassle. the fron staff are friendly I had no complaints. The only issue that DID NOT bother me was the fact that you can hear all the party goers at night. But again, I was not bothered with that. Overall, I would for sure stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but oh the jack hammer...”
Reviews.Author: bhbb627
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was very nice except if we took a HOT shower the fire alarm would go off in the room above so they would run down and have us turn off the shower. OH, but the jack hammer.... We were on the 2nd floor back of hotel and the neighboring property was remodeling so every morning at 9 a.m the jack hammering would begin.... Needless to say it was not a very good stay but don't know how the hotel could have prevented the jack hammering since it was not under their control. Good location easy to get on and off tram. Indonesian restaurant down street in yellow building is AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive!”
Reviews.Author: chinchinita
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel from 30.06. to 04.07.08 in a Junior suite. The suite itself was spacious and its comfort adequate, but I was shocked to the see how dirty it was. We were on the first floor, facing the backyard, as this was supposed to be calm, but as our suite was directly above the kitchen there was a nice background noise from its air conditioning, but fortunately it was shut down before midnight. Our room did not have one, so I am grateful it was not too hot. There was also a house on the other side of the backyard that was being renovated, and the work (compressors, etc) started at 8:00am. Of course the hotel was not responsible for that inconvenience, but neither was there a small basket of fruit or anything else as an apology for being awakened so early during your holiday. It is true that the location is excellent, if you arrive by train the Tram No 4 or 9 will drop you on the Rembrandtplein, directly in front of the Hotel, and around are plenty of restaurants. I can only recommend Memories of India which serves the best Indian food that it was my pleasure to eat. Reception was cool, if you asked you got your information, but nothing else. As for breakfast I can but strongly recommend not to take it in the hotel as it is much too expensive for what they are offering. The buffet has all essentials, hot meat, cold fruit, yogurts, cereals, etc, but no luxury items like cold salm or exotic fruits. Personally I am a fan of french breakfast and their croissants and the bread are not exactly the same as their french cousins. Also for coffee, tea or hot chocolates you have to serve yourselves from a sophisticated machine, but as it happened twice in the 5 mornings that we were there, they forgot either to stock up the milk powder or the coffee. I also managed during those five mornings to eat their entire stock of those cute little Nutella pads. As I took only 3 each morning I have no great estimation for their stocking ability, nor do I think much of their surveillance of the buffet. So my rÃ©sumÃ©, not enough value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice in a perfect location...”
Reviews.Author: cisalpino777
Reviews.Content: this Hotel was not our first choice... We booked on the website at NH Caransa which is just at the opposite side of the square but they switched us to the Schiller. We have been very lucky.. We have been upgraded and we stayed in a renewed room at the third floor quiet large and with all the confort you need. The location of the hotel is almost perfect (city center), but if you are looking for a quiet place it's better to choose a different place (Rembrandtplain is full of restaurants, bars and there is an intense night life). The staff has been very kind and our 3 nights has been fantastic. Enjoy Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PamelaSF
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Central Station and got on the No16 Tram outside. It brought us to Multiplein where we hoped off, crossed the road and arrived at Rembrant Square where our hotel was located. Greated by real friendly staff. Hotel room was a standard, and was perfect for us. it was located to the front of the hotel so we could open window and look out at the restaurants and people. , It was a bit noisy at night but I think whatever hotel you book in amsterdam, noise will always be a problem. Hotel is in a great location, 10 min walk to red light, 10 min to Shopping district, 10 min to Dam Square, its a great location. If i ever come back I will book this hotel. we booked out early and was able to leave bags at reception. When we left, we hoped onthe no 4 tram outside the hotel streight to Central Station. Great 4 days break.
