Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Schiller grew on me!”
Reviews.Author: SusieG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were booked in here for 5 nights recently by his company for his business trip - me just along to visit Amsterdam for the first time. It was a convenient choice for us both. The easiest way to arrive from the airport is to take the train (tickets on sale in the airport luggage hall) and walk onto the platform five minutes away. We were in Central Station in 15 mins. Walk just outside and get on a no 4 or 9 tram (it's the terminus, so no worries about which direction to go!). Ask for the Rembrandtplein (square), about 5 mins away, and the hotel is immediately opposite. So, much cheaper - and quicker - than a taxi or the hotel shuttle bus, for which there were huge queues. The hotel is supposed to be an Amsterdam 'landmark' - over 100 years old. I was initially disappointed; the entrance and lobby are small and dark and looked a little worn. The lift is antiquated. But the staff couldnt have been more helpful. Having read Tripadvisor reviews I had asked for a quiet room at the rear,and this was the best piece of advice I got!! The noise at the front of the hotel must be awful at night and especially at weekends with all the bars and cafes in the square and the clanking trams! Butwe were upgraded to a more spacious business room at the rear which was comfortable and very quiet. The beds were extremely comfortable, bathroom small but perfectly adequate with masses of hot water; nice flatscreen TV Breakfasts in the Cafe Schiller were good - a range of hot and cold dishes, plenty of fruit, choice of lovely breads etc. You could even have sparking champagne if you wanted! And the cafe area was what actually 'grew on me'; it was quite nice to be in an older building with some character and charm instead of the usual modern hotel areas you find everywhere. The best thing was the convenience of being able to walk to every major sight in minutes. Turn left out of the hotel and left again and within two minutes you were on the quietest canals with their wonderful architecture. Two minutes in the other direction and you were in the heart of the city. We ate in some good restaurants - but the best by far was again two minutes away - down the road to the left of the hotel which leads to the canal. On the corner over the first bridge is a tiny Italian place - only about 8 tables - called Ponte Arcelo (or something like that!) run by two Italians. Fantastic food - whatever was fresh that day - you had to pay cash, but it was so cheap and absolutely delicious - a real find. So, overall a good stay - but remember to get that room at the back of the hotel if you plan any sleep at all!

Reviews.Title: “NIce Hotel - Not Amazing”
Reviews.Author: sandypWaterford
Reviews.Content: I had been warned to go for as high standard of hotel as possible in Amsterdam, I got a good deal on the Schiller which included breakfast, but I could honestly say I wouldnt class this as a 4 star hotel. It was a very nice hotel, the beds were extremely comfortable, we had a lovely (small) room overlooking Rembrandt square, the room had a balcony which was really nice (although you wouldn't spend too much time out on it in feb..brrrr), I would like to see that during the Summer! The noise wasn't as bad as I expected from the square, but definitely if you were a light sleeper I'd say it would be a different story! The toiletries in the bathroom definitely deserve a mention, they were lovely, I smelled like a fruit salad for the weekend!!! I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, both on reception and in the bar -drink prices are quite saucy in the bar though..you have been warned!! - the lady who served us breakfast was particularly nice. The breakfast was delicious, with a great selection of pretty much everything, and kept well topped up. There was some kind of party on downstairs on the Saturday night, and the music was VERY loud, it didnt bother us too much as we were heading out ourselves, but if you were planning an early night it would have been fairly upsetting! (although who would have an early night on Saturday in Amsterdam??) All in all I would return to the NH Schiller because I have no real negatives about my stay, but I would be looking for a special offer again, as I wouldnt pay 4 star prices for it.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvindublin
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a central location of Amsterdam. The tram drops you off just across the street, it could not have been any more convenient. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were well appointed and we got a great rate when we booked in advance. You are in walking distance of many of the city's attractions. We'd definitely stay again next time we visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Another one in the crowd”
Reviews.Author: Jumper71
Reviews.Content: NH Schiller have old school charm but are newly renovated. Strangely enough my room (103) was still pestered with noise from the old floorboards. I stayed in a single room and had little space for anything apart from sleeping. TV was located in a way that made it difficult to look at it from the bed. For a person that likes to watch TV after a night out that can be quite frustrating or at least result in a stiff neck the next morning. My colleagues on this business trip seemed rather pleased with their rooms but not overenthusiastic. The breakfastroom was as the rest of the hotel Old school but not very charmy. To have undergone a refurbishement I must admit that I wondered why they hadnÂ´t try to give the hotel more new charm. Location is very central and the hotel was overall very clean and staff gave good enough service. So if you have no need for that little extra touch and service I believe this to be a good choice. Despite all the original paintings of the artist Schiller in the public areas (hence the name) I found the hotel to lack that unique touch that will make me a returning guest. Notice that rooms fronting the park are quite noisy so if youÂ´re a light sleeper you must ask for a room facing the backyard. There are plenty of clubs around the Rembrandt Square were the hotel are located.

Reviews.Title: “great but noisy”
Reviews.Author: BETTYCork
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at this hotel. Sat-Tues. Very good hotel. Great size room. Great breakfast. Excellent staff. Great location. Great price booked through aer lingus.com. However, our room was at the front of the hotel. Five in the morning very noisy groups were still roaring and shouting outside. The tram was also very noisy. It didnt spoil our stay but I would insist on a rear room if I were to book again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Barsuchok
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved it! Lovely sunny room with nicely touches in the bathroom (new toothbrush, hair brush, spounge etc) and generous tea/coffee facilities. Superb Location. Service - nothing special but no errors as well. We booked for the first 3 days of our stay hotel Patou, since were seduced by its generous reviews and didn't like it, than went for NH Shiller since it was much more cheaper though with average reviews. After that we were convinced that it's still important to look at the hotel class not only reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kawaai
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very easy to find, with a tram stop right across the square, which goes directly to the central station. Lots of lovely resteraunts and bars in the smaller streets nearby as well as plenty of shops. We found the location great, and walked to most places, and it's not especially rowdy or tacky as some reviewers have described it, yes it's lively but we had a room at the back which was very peaceful. We had to keep the windows open at night as it was so warm in the room and still we didn't have any issues with noise. Room was tasteful, modern and well decorated, not huge, but much bigger than the room we had at the Victoria hotel a few years back. There was enough room to walk around, as well as tea/ coffee making facilities. It was clean, very comfortable and relaxing. Loved the little touches like the book of bed time stories, and choice of pillows as well as the generous selection of bathroom toiletries & ammenities. Breakfast was good, with an average selection which was regularly topped up. Staff were always pleasant and helpful throughout our stay. Found an excellent deal on this hotel for 3 nights with breakfast, which made it a lot cheaper than some of the lower class hotels much further out. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, no parking”
Reviews.Author: ralfvd
Reviews.Content: NH Schiller hotel is a NH hotel on a great location in Amsterdam, the Rembrandtplein. Be sure to go to the right NH hotel, there are two on Rembrandtplein. I tried to check in at the wrong one, but they can see each others reservations so I was easily rerouted to the right hotel. Check in was easy and friendly. They remember me calling 30 minutes before asking for parking directions. Although NH advertises that this hotel has parking spaces, you have to park at Amsterdam's public parking garages, which will set you back around 30 EUR per 24 hours, and a 10 minute walk to the hotel. Hotel room was spacious and very clean. Breakfast was allright, just a normal continental breakfast you'd expect in this kind of hotel. I was only here for one night, so I didn't check any other facilities of this hotel. Overall, if you can find a good deal, this is a good location for exploring Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: BamaDave
Reviews.Content: I will preface this review by noting that this was my first trip to Amsterdam and by reading previous numerous reviews of the hotels their I have come to the conclusion that rooms are SMALL. My room was very small by American standards but don't let me give you the wrong impression. For one person it was the perfect size. It was a standard single bed for which I payed 502 Euros for 3 nights. I realize that this may seem high but it was actually quite fair considering the prices of many many other hotels I looked into. So, on with the review. The hotel is very easily accessible via the tram from Central Station, the stop is directly across from the entrance. The room was exceptionally clean with a flat screen lcd tv, mini bar, desk, and comfortable bed. I will say that I was there in October so the weather was quite moderate....this room didn't have any type of air conditioning so I would ask first in the summer before staying. I can't imagine the heat then. As for the restaurant and bar, the service was impeccable as was the food. If you have never had a Heineken in Amsterdam, you must try one. The waiter convinced me and I could not believe the difference of taste. As for the location, this area is very nice for anyone who wants to walk downtown Amsterdam. The city is fairly small and you can walk it in about 30 minutes from one side to the next(I am 38 and out of shape and done it). I have a hard time comparing this to other hotels but I will say that after reading so many bad reviews of hotels in Amsterdam that I was very pleasantly surprised with this selection. I would recommend it to anyone other than handicapped.

Reviews.Title: “A decent stay but not a must. Overall, try elsewhere first”
Reviews.Author: gnasty71
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter (toddler) and I visited Amsterdam in September 2007. We were there for a business conference as well as sightseeing and the conference had a certain set of hotels that we could use so we stayed at the NH Schiller and the NH Caransa(separate review). NH Schiiler is right in Rembrantplein. Its literally in the square. You don't really get a sense of this when you visit the NH website and frankly, the website photo makes it look better than it is. So what does that mean for you? The good is that is a pretty major stop for the trams which are great public transportation in the city. Its also pretty centrally located. About a 20 min walk to Central Station, 20 mins to Leidesplein and Museumplein, very close to Spui. Bad news, there are tons of restaurants, neon lights and a huge TV screen. Think a small New York Times Square. So its bright and noisy. If you are a light sleeper, beware. It was pretty noisy. Our room faced the main square. The are restaurants all around but the neon lights are across the square, separated by a small park so that does reduce some of the brightness. Inside, its an interesting mix. The hotel exterior and lobby is very old. Quaint? Its style is early-mid 20th century but a bit rundown looking to me. They are in the process of remodeling but I am unsure of what parts they will change. The rooms themselves were very new and modern and all the NH hotels seem to have a similar decor. They are a pretty good size, especially for european rooms. Only issue was the bathroom but I'll get to that later. The TVs are flat screens. The room has a built in safe for valuables. There is a nice reading chair by the window to relax in. The only negative was the bathroom. First, the bathroom door opens up right by the bed. Its one of those rooms where you enter the bath, straight from the bedroom. The bath was older and cramped. The shower was the worst part. The shower is a bit old and the tiles had some stains. The problem was the shower curtain was a flimsy and didn't reach the bottom. The water would leak and flood the floor all the time. We only stayed here 2 days and moved across the street to the NH Caransa. It wasn't because of the room, we just booked it that way because of availability but it ended up as a better situation. The staff was very friendly and gave my daughter a kid's kit of puzzles and art supplies. Our room fee was still pretty expensive but that is also largely due to the exchange rate these days which is pretty terrible for US travelers. The fee (for us) included free breakfast in the restaurant. Its a restaurant connected to the hotel. It smelled of smoke as there are smoking sections in the restaurant. The selection was pretty good. Plenty of fruit, cereals, jams as well as your standard eggs, sausages, bacon, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get a room at the back of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: BelindaTrent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Schiller for the Amsterdam Marathon weekend - we have stayed in Amsterdam many times but left booking a little late this time so ended up in this hotel on tacky Rembrantplein..... On the upside, it is very close to the main attractions and trams etc. The rooms were nice and clean but the hotel overall seemed dated and a bit lacklustre. Our first room was on the front side of the hotel - the noise at night was absolutely unbearable, it sounded like someone had set speakers up in our room. We asked to change for our remaining two nights and were moved to a much smaller but quiet room at the back. Bliss, particularly when you need to be well rested before a big run! The rooms overall were clean and well appointed. We only had breakfast on one morning, but found it to be adequate if a little uninspired. There are much better hotels in Amsterdam for the same price or less.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JOROM123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH Schiller hotel, during our European Holiday. The hotel is in an excellent location, close to everything!!! We were impressed with the excellent service at Reception upon arrival. Staff were very friendly and spoke great English. The room & hotel has recently been refurbished and even though the lobby is a little outdated, the rooms themselves are excellent, extremely clean and modern. The beds were very comfortable and the room had a plasma tv mounted on the wall. The toilletries in the bathroom were also exceptional and I kept many of them to use at other hotels later on in our trip!. Would definately recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: lozbex
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel mainly down to the reviews on this site for a 2 night stay and where indeed not disappointed. The hotel was first class. They let us check in early upon our arrival (checked in at 10.00am instead of 15.00 hrs.) The room that we stayed in had been recently refurbished and the bed was oh so comfortable. The hotel location was spot on right next to Rembrandt Square with plenty of bars and restaurants close by. Overall the hotel certainly was worth booking and will definitely be returning again soon.

Reviews.Title: “NH Schiller Was Perfect”
Reviews.Author: bspecht
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about the NH Schiller. My wife and I flew into Amsterdam at 9am and finally arrived at the Schiller at 10:30am. We had an overnight flight so we were exhasted and needed a shower. The staff was SO friendly and helpful when we arrived. Since it was so early our room wasn't quite ready, but they made efforts to speed up their cleaning so that we could check in early, at no extra charge and they invited us to relax in their very nice restaurant and offered us a complimentary coffee. The front desk was friendly, attentive and very helpful. When we finally checked in, we found our room was very comfortable, clean and well equipped. The room was small but perfect for the two of us. I was concerned when we booked that the Schiller didn't have AC, but we found Amsterdam to be very cool while we were there, so that was never an issue and I don't see that it ever would. Most hotels in Amsterdam don't have AC because it's not needed, due to their almost perfect weather. We were so pleased with the Schiller and hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, great rooms.”
Reviews.Author: VKDiver
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked one night at the hotel as a treat for us after visiting his parents in Holland and we had a nice night. From the train station it was a 15 euro, 5 minute taxi journey which i thought was expensive. We would have walked but it was raining. We arrived at midday and checked in straight away, we were on the 3rd floor with a view over the square. The rooms have been recently refurbished and are up to a good standard. We were in a standard room, which was fairly small but clean and tidy. The room included flat screen TV, excellent toiletries and a choice of pillows, which is a nice touch. The location is excellent a 5 minute walk to the main shopping area and all other attractions are easily accessiable. We didnt eat in the restaurant in the evening, but we went to Bubbles and Wine on Nes for drinks which was fab, it has an excellent selection of champagnes and then dined out Harimeke Brassiere, which was excellent, it has a small menu but all seasonal. The breakfast had a nice selection, though a little bit limited. There was a selection of fruits, cereal, dried fruits and hot breakfast. Overall a pleasant stay, would go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Francesca_Bowie
Reviews.Content: The expectactions were high because of the price. The room was on the back, without view on Rembrandtplein. We booked a standard double room, but we couldn't change it, because apparently fully-booked. The building is old, but our room was good, not spectacular, but renovated and clean. People at the reception were very nice. This hotel is excellent for the location. There is a shuttle that goes straight from the airport to the hotel (19â‚¬ return ticket). I would recommend to anyone who is planning to stay only for few days. I'm sure you will enjoy it. Francesca and Max, Rome, Italy

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the moeny”
Reviews.Author: babylion
Reviews.Content: Central hotel located on the horrible, noisy, tacky Rembrantplein. Request a room at the back of the hotel where it is quieter! Rooms are nice and newly furnished, if a little cramped. Hotel was being refurbished when we stayed so corridors etc were a bit of a mess. Reception area and restaurant do have some lovely art deco features but all the communal areas are just a bit shabby for the cost. There are better hotels than this in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to access all of Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: DamLover
Reviews.Content: Had a great romantic weekend away at this hotel. We had stayed before but it has since been renovated to a very high standard. Work still ongoing but but not so much that it caused us any interference. Our room was was modern, clean and bright - the only criticism being the floor squeaked badly!! Thankfully the above room floor did not but I would not have liked to have been a guest in the room below us!! We found the hotel to be very busy with guests and visitors - the hotel bar is very popular with locals on a Friday night - Just how we like it. The hotel is in a fantastic location for all things Amsterdam. The main shopping area is less than 5mins walk away. Rembrandt Plein itself is buzzing with life - clubs, bars coffeshops etc. Leidesplein, Dam Square and the Redlight area are all within 10mins walk of the hotel. If however you are really lazy you can catch a tram (number 4 or 9) across the square from the hotel. We would highly reccomend this hotel to couples who require a decent standard of living combined with great night life and reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: inlisbon
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel with good atmosphere. The rooms can be very different so try to get a good one! The restaurant/bar in the premises is very good with excellent service.When we arrived to the hotel the check in clerck had that kind of attitude "at the price you paid for a superior room you will suffer"...so we waited too long for the room and,when we did ask for a front room, he gave us a courtyard room, just for the statement.It was the only exception, the other people where really nice.You can walk to most places but the area itself is much too touristy for me.For the best and for the worse you have a nice bar just next to the hotel and next door a "smokatorium"...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: jmilne3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely - staff very helpful and the bath was HUGE! Very nice clean rooms, although there is some building work going on at the back of the hotel and unfortunately builders in Amsterdam seem to start work at 7.30am. But that's not the hotel's fault! Very good central location, and they didn't seem to mind us disappearing up to the room with MacDonalds bags and chinese takeaways! Would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - under construction!”
Reviews.Author: brooklyncouple
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the NH Schiller for this past weekend (Feb 07). We booked the room on Travelocity and called the hotel directly to confirm 2 days before departing. When we arrived at Rembrandtplein (the square in front of the hotel) after a long overnight flight, we heard the sounds of some SERIOUS construction work going on in the upper floors of the hotel (it was loud enough to hear from the square outside). At check-in, the desk attendant told us that the hotel was under renovation and that the remaining rooms were fully booked. No idea why we weren't told this when we called, but they called us a cab and transferred us to the NH Krasnapolsky on Dam Square. Overall, I think it was a trade-up bc the Kras is quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “First Visit”
Reviews.Author: jo_and_karl
Reviews.Content: Right from beginning to end , the hotel and staff were an absolute dream. We arrived late evening to be checked in with a smile and got told we had been given a Superior room, the excellent staff member then proceeded to point out everything we needed to know and indicate it on a hotel map for us. Things started well and just got better as our stay went on ! Our first morning we went down to brasserie for breakfast and were amazed at the standard and choice that was on offer. The staff are the best that we have ever experienced and a credit to a top class hotel . On our last night the barman was only to happy to chat about all the drinks on offer and obliged us with samples ... fantastic!! We would definately come to Amsterdam again and this hotel would be one of our main reasons.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vaishyv
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel. Rooms were classy, clean and had everything I could have needed during my trip. Only a 5 minute tram ride away from central station. Plenty of nice eating places around the hotel- 'wok to walk' served fab noddles, 'du monde' made the best dutch pancakes, 'rain' was a fab upmarket bar/restaurant/club that served cool cocktails. Was highly impressed by the location of the hotel. Would definitely come back to Amsterdam just to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Art!”
Reviews.Author: EnglandMonkeys!
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the end of December. We loved this hotel. The room was clean and the bathroom was sparkling. The true gems of this hotel are the glam art deco lobby and restaurant (the old back part not the "new" glass addition at the front. They are crammed with Frans Schiller's paintings. He seemed to paint just about everything! It would have been nice to be able to find out more information from the hotel about the paintings/painter. I didn't realise that they were all by F. Schiller until closer inspection! If you want a peaceful nights sleep I would suggest requesting a room in the back of the hotel. It is on quite a busy square and is quietish during the day with only the tram bell and some tourist noises. Though square becomes a different beast at night hosting a 2,000 capacity club right across the square that lets out at about 5:30 in the morning which has a jumbo telly mounted on the outside that creates lots of flashing light for your room. Amsterdam also seem to replace the trams with diesel busses (surely to carry more people) during the night and they are very very loud (shaking the building loud!) All of these things have nothing to do with the hotel but just a fair warning (bring your earplugs or join them at the club!) The hotel is from a different era and classy! There is also a cafÃ© on the right of the hotel entrance that his affiliated with the hotel which is also lovely (though there is no internal entrance, you have to go outside to get to it) but it is a quaint oasis from the other touristy places on the square.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: jr_sasser81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel after reading many reviews online about our options. It was a good price, and little did we know it was in a FANTASTIC location! We had the Connexxion shuttle from the airport drop us off there..which I would definitely recommend people looking into. For the two of us it was 32 Euros round trip. The staff was very nice and helpful, and made sure to wish us a Happy Anniversary when we checked in (which I had mentioned months in advance in an email inquiring about transportation, so I was very suprised). There was a lift (which I was VERY glad about after reading many reviews about hotels not having them), the room was clean (a little small- but perfect for what we needed) and the view was beautiful. The only thing I would say is, if it's not included in the room, DON'T eat breakfast there. The food was decent...but it cost us 18 euros a person for breakfast...it wasn't that freaking good!! All in all, I'd recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam for an AMAZING vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: divaleh
Reviews.Content: Great location in the City Center - easy tram ride right to the hotel from the train station. Get a room in the back, rooms with a view are LOUD :) Comfy bed, nice amenities. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: mel4
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a terrific holiday in AMsterdam. The Schiller was a perfect place to stay. Rooms were large, comfortable with upscale toiletries and coazy bed. CLean and modern bathrooms. The breakfast was included on my stay and it was bountiful, with many choices and a beautiful setting. Staff was helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: nico_ch
Reviews.Content: The Schiller's location is pretty cool. Quite some people love the hotel because of the old design, which is cool in the entrance and the restaurant, but the floors and the rooms start to become really oldish. The rooms are a bit small (we're not in Tokyo !), the toilets aren't very comfortable (because of the way they are placed in the bath room). Breakfast is average. Also, if you are there during a week-end, and want a quiet room, avoid the ones facing the place.

Reviews.Title: “A super break in Rembrandtsplein”
Reviews.Author: Brunnsum
Reviews.Content: A very good three star hotel in a wonderful location for the City Centre and all areas thanks to the tram stop just the other side of the square. The rooms were a bit small but very well appointed and spotless. Lots of little extras and helpful staff make for a very welcoming experience. Will stay there again on my next trip. Have a breakfast at the Three Sisters Pub one morning. The bacon is to die for.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars????????”
Reviews.Author: Ciccomillino
Reviews.Content: I start from the good things: 1) Great location, central and quiet. 2) Wonderful breakfast Negativity: At the arrival the room was not ready. The people at the desk not friendly or helpful. Unbelieveble bad: the room was not so small, ma equally was disgusting. Walls skretched, shower broken. Furniture was very old and in bathroom there was not a single place where tu put your personal things. Every thing looked very, very poor. NOT FOR FOUR STARS!!!!!!!!!! I saw even two stars hotel with better rooms! The view from the window? An orrible internal view of old walls around and a very bed smell coming in from outside. Leave closed!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable Schiller”
Reviews.Author: fisches
Reviews.Content: We were treated wonderfully here. Friendly and helpful front desk. Get a room in back..off the Rembrandt Plein if you want quiet. Those are larger, anyway. The amenities in the room are spa caliber and you can buy larger containers to take home. Bed were comfy with two down pillows. Big bathroom with tub, The Schiller Cafe food was superb! We were so pleasantly suprised. Lots of high-end type locals there and I see why. Location is good...a tram stop is right in front of the hotel. Lots of fun little ethnic eateries near. Very comfortable and friendly hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room in the Schiller”
Reviews.Author: pkbpkb
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. Upon arrival we were given room 118, which seemed to be in a kind of annex. We had to go up in the lift and then down some very steep steps to this room. I made the point that I wasn't overly happy as the steps could be dangerous for my pregnant wife. The staff at the front desk made no fuss and transferred us to a room nearer the lift. This was a lovely room - first floor again - with a balcony looking out over the Rembrandtplein. A really first-class room. There was a very good spread for breakfast. Yes, I would recommend this hotel - but only because of the second room, certainly not because of the original dingy room!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Schiller”
Reviews.Author: slp75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Schiller for three nights just this week. When I arrived, I requested a room in the back for my 80 year old mother and her friend because I had read about the noise. I can't say enought about the staff on both the day and night time shifts. The woman on the desk in the evening was exceptional! We were given a free upgrade and the room was huge. It had a kitchenette, two twin beds, a pull-out couch and two chairs. The furniture was rather old and very soft mattresses but no complaints from us. My sister and I had a room in the front of the building and it was LOUD on Sunday night but Monday and Tuesday were reasonable and we were able to sleep with windows open. We requested fans for both rooms and they were immediately sent up. I loved the complimentary collection of short stories left on the night table for the guests. We had the hot breakfast buffet every mornng which had a wide selection. Very expensive if paying for it off the menu, but it was included with teh price of our room. We payed about $200 ( per room) per night and that included the breakfast. Both our rooms were extremely large and very clean. My mother uses a wheelchair and they had two lifts, which was very helpful. The location was great, especially since the tram stops right at Rembrantplein and we took it often.

Reviews.Title: “Undecided”
Reviews.Author: wreimer
Reviews.Content: Although, I loved Amsterdam and this location was central, beware of a Saturday night stay. It was loud until 5 am. Be prepared to bring ear plugs..there is no way to sleep through it. Also, the beds were ridiculously soft, no real support. My guess, is they are well overdue for replacement. The front desk staff were friendly, but moved slow (especially the evening staff). Had more help from the daytime staff. Excellent Peruvian Restaurant nearby...take right out the hotel, then a right at the first street. It is on the right side. Best meal in Amsterdam!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BTK
Reviews.Content: Spent July 6-9, 2006 at the NH Schiller. The hotel is directly on Rembrandtplein which is excellent or horrible depending on your perspective. We loved it. Pro - excellent central location that is in between the museum neighborhood and the old city. Pro - Rembrandtplein is the heart of the club sceen and bars/clubs are open all night. Con - because it is fun central, it is loud all night long. So, if you are planning on staying out for late night fun and can sleep through some noise, it is a prime location. If you want quiet, do not stay there. Staff was excellent and very friendly. Room was decent size, very clean. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but beware”
Reviews.Author: NickUp
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel with plenty of character and a great location for sightseeing. You can walk to almost everywhere that you would want to visit. One word of warning however, Amsterdam is a party town and Rembrandtplein is not a peaceful little square.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel shame about the room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel great location shame about our room,booked 2 months in advance via expedia requesting a non smoking room midweek for 3 days,upon arrival we waited 15mins for checkin to phone another office to authorize a room,approx 10`x10`which on entering stank of smoke,asked if they could change room but said they only had smoking rooms left,accepted this without any fuss and unpacked,we then noticed a rumble coming from the bedside unit which was a channel for some form of extraction ducting which was on the wall outside,it wasnt until you tried to get some sleep that you realized how noisey this was and coupled with a function room below us which added even more noise,we are not whingers and are hotel owners ourselves and this will be our 2nd bad experience ,we paid 308.00 pounds for this room which in our opinion is not fit for its purpose ,should be used as a freshen up room for waiting ,moral dont book a good online deal ,you get what you pay for.Room 118

Reviews.Title: “NH Schiller... not a bad choice”
Reviews.Author: TxMan05
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 1 week stay at the NH Schiller. Overall it is a nice hotel in a good central location. The room I had was a single so it was a bit small as to be expected. The room was nice and the bed was very comfortable. I did have a large bathroom with a tub which was good to relax in after a day of walking all over Amsterdam. The hotel has a breakfast buffet which at 16 euros is expensive but good quality and convienient. There are plenty of restaraunts around Rembrantplein to eat at for about half as much. Full English breakfast across the square at Three Sisters was a good value. As noted in other reviews the staff was pleasent but sometimes gave contradictory information, especially about the shuttle back to the airport. In any event we made it back to the airport without any problems. Overall I would have to say my stay was pleasent enough. Expedia screwed up my number of nights and I was billed 1 night at full rack rate of $179 euros, but was not the hotels fault.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and room, but...”
Reviews.Author: bluesgirl72
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here March 30-April 2, 2006. The location was great, close to everything, we walked all over Amsterdam from here. The room was lovely, on the second floor overlooking the Rembrandtplein. A little noisy on Saturday night, but not bad. The staff was what was unpredictable. When we checked in, the man was very nice and cheery. When we asked for an ice bucket, it was sent up quickly. The rest of the time our requests were met with little or no help or information. Nothing complicated or out of the realm of what might be expected of hotel staff. We asked some simple questions about shops nearby and received some vague and icy answers. When we asked about trams and arranging transport to the airport, we recieved no help at all. It seemed unprofessional at best.

Reviews.Title: “Old Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Daniele454
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the NH Schiller from the 21-24 of march, 06. Our train from Paris broke down in Antwerp so we checked in late, we were upgraded to a suite with a balcony overlooking Rembrandts statue and the Night Watch. There was a coffee shop right next door and a Burger king & McDonalds down the street (if you get a craving for home). There is a tram stop right on the square and it easy and affordable to use. The staff at the Schiller was amazing. The cappucino in the brasserie was the best I have ever had and the decor throughout the hotel was beautiful. I recommend going to the Schiller cafe for drinks only, just to see the gorgeous deco lighting. I have fallen in love with Amsterdam and when I return it will be to the Schiller.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted.”
Reviews.Author: Sharon41
Reviews.Content: The NH Schiller has to be our favourite hotel in Amsterdam. My husband and I try to have a week-end break (just the two of us) at least once a year and we keep finding ourselves back in Amsterdam, at the NH Schiller. The location couldn't be more perfect. Its centrally located, so ideal for walking to the museums, galleries, markets, shops..........I could keep going but I wont. The staff at the hotel couldn't be more helpful. When we arrived, we found our room wasn't ready. Instead of asking us to wait, (check in is at 3.00pm) it was almost 4.00pm, they upgraded us at no extra cost, compliments of the hotel. I'd advise buying your water, drinks, snacks at the shops as the prices are quite expensive. Bottled water is 2.50 euro to give a rough guide. We have decided to take another trip in 4 weeks time (once again staying at the NH Schiller). This is our 7th trip and our 5th stay at the Schiller, what more can I say?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy56
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 night city break at the Hotel Schiller and couldn't be more pleased with our choice of accommodation. After reading reports on trip advisor I had reserved a twin room at the back of the hotel to avoid noise. However, we arrived at the hotel at 10.30am (having been up since 3.30am!) and already knew that check in time wasn't til 3pm. We were fully prepared to leave our luggage and come back later. The staff offered us a room at the front of the hotel which was already available and a free upgrade to a business class suite! Decision time... nicer room but possibly noisy.. We took the upgrade and were delighted. Spacious clean room with mini bar, safe and lovely seating area. The TV wished us a pleasant stay when we switched it on! This might be normal practice when you stay in a hotel but a complete novelty for us! (We don't get out much!!) Room was not too noisy despite one of the nights we stayed being a Saturday. Occasional trams rumbling by which I found quite comforting. Windows didn't fit too well and quite a draft through - temps very low whilst we were there but this was our only gripe. We ate in the hotel the first night which was a bit of a treat as quite expensive. We ordered a bottle of house white and was asked to taste another wine to see what we thought. It was lovely but double the price - they sold it to us for the same price as the house white! Beautiful paintings all over the hotel by Mr Schiller. Worth a good look, they are everywhere, look above you! A beautiful painting above and opposite the lift in the lobby. Hotel in good central position. You can walk everywhere from here and will miss so much if you are lazy and take the tram! This was my second visit to Amsterdam. It was just as vibrant and diverse as I remembered it.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Coxei
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a lovely stay at the NH Schiller. We booked this room in November and had a 'buy two nights get one free deal' including breakfast, so had 3 nights Sa/Sun/Mon for less than Â£200. I has requested a non smoking, quiet room and this is just what we had, with a king size bed, two armchairs and a desk, a choice of pillows, chocolate on your pillow each day, tea/ coffee, toiletries in a spotlessly clean bathroom etc, and although we didn't use the mini bar, we did use the fridge. There was an ice machine on our floor (previous review said they would have liked one)and a canned drinks machine. The staff at reception were more than helpful, giving us a map, showing us where to go and also looking after our luggage on our last day as we had a early evening flight. The bar was no more expensive than anywhere else we visited for drinks, and the breakfast was fine, lots of breads, jams, meats, cheeses, fresh fruit salad, fresh fruit, salad, yoghurts, cereals, juices, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage and good coffee, all help yourself. It was snowing whilst we were there, but the rooms were very warm. We couldn't fault it. The location was ideal, easy to get everwhere and a tram stop less than a minute away.

Reviews.Title: “great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: greenjdmd
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing and the front-desk staff helpful and fluent in English. The room is spacious and clean. We were glad we took the advice of other Trip Advisor visitors and asked for a room away from the noise of the main square. The area is very busy, even in winter. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: JazSingh
Reviews.Content: We came for a long weekend and had been to Amsterdam before. For once the reviews about this hotel were right. Nice rooms, great location on Rembrandtplein - central. Everything within walking distance. It was a bit pricy (e.g. 2.50 euros for a small bottle of water), and our rooms had no mini-bar. I had a room at the front and there was the rumble of trams every now and again, but they were bearable - the rooms are well insulated for sound and heat.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: KCJB
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the NH Schiller. As with previous reviews the location is fantastic. 4 tram stops from Central Station with the tram stop a 2 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel staff are very friendly and accommodating. On reading previous reviews we asked for a room at the back of the hotel and it was lovely and quiet in the evenings. The room was very nice, clean with a comfy bed. There are plenty of bars and restaurants around the hotel but can highly recommend a bar called Gollem which was recommended by the hotel staff - they have over 200 beers!! We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Jenns0019
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night weekend in Amsterdam. The NH Schiller was the perfect choice. The location is perfect. Just a 10 min or so walk to Dam Square and the Red Light District, and right out the door in Rembrandt square you can find just about anything for dining and entertainment. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was nice, very clean and the bathroom was spotless. The only minor problem was the location of the room, we were in room 120 and it is right near a bar which made it a bit noisy at night. Luckily we're late night people so it didnt bother us too much. I would definatley stay at the Schiller again and recommend it to anyone going to Amsterdam. One small tip. If you're from the US and plan on changing money at an exchange center, we found out that most places will not accept $100 bills with a serial date from 2001. Apparently there were a number of counterfiet bills during that year, so most won't take them. Luckily we had enough not to worry, but did find a Western Union near the hotel that took them without question.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: enemy01
Reviews.Content: The Schiller hotel was just what we were looking for from a short break in Amsterdam. The hotel is located right on Rembrandt Square, close to lots of clubs, restaurants and coffee shops if that is what you want. The tram stops on the other side of Rembrandt Square and makes it easy to get around Amsterdam. Our rooms were at the rear of the hotel, so we had no problems with noise at night, although I think the front rooms may have been more noisy, but that is what you would expect if you want to be close to all the restaurants and bars. The hotel is very attractive with its art deco history. The rooms were very clean and the bathrooms were great. In house movies were good too for a fee. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant so I can't comment on that, but from the menu it seemed interesting if a little expensive. I would recommend staying in this hotel if you do not have children, I don't think I saw more than a few children staying here. It suits couples or a group of friends.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and I got an executive room with a balcony heading the rembrandtplein itself. room was very nice with minibar and stuff i really enjoyed staying there. The staff was nice and smiley too. I would surely comeback! A tip for everyone: check rates as close as you can to your stay because it changes all the time!

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although our level smelt of marijuana a lot of the time, we were impressed with the helpful staff, until we found that we some money skimmed and stolen from what we thought was a secure location in our personal items. The hotel refuses to take any responsibility for their staff, and maintains that any items not placed in the small safe are able to be taken and they are not liable. I was very unimpressed by this. So my advice to other slightly naive travellers would be to take important things with you. You really cant trust anyone these days, not even the people who knock on your door, smile at you and cheerfully utter, "housekeeping".

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: NewYear'sTraveller
Reviews.Content: We loved the Schiller hotel during our 3 night stay in Amsterdam. It has a wonderful central location and right in the middle of city bustle. The hallways were a bit tired but the rooms were nicely furnished. We we upgraded to a large room at the front of the hotel with a large balcony overlooking the square. A tiny bit noisy but we didn't mind. All in all a great value for Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location. On a square with many decent affordable restaurants. Rooms were decent. Bathrooms were very clean. I thought this hotel was nice.

HotelInfo.Name: NH Schiller
HotelInfo.Address: Rembrandtplein 26-36, Amsterdam 1017 CV, The Netherlands (Formerly Golden Tulip Schiller)
